text: [Charlie]: I haven't seen much of Dave or Alice; their absence is a bit unusual, and I'm curious if anyone else has noticed any inconsistencies in task completion.
[Bob]: Charlie, I saw you kill Erin in the Cafeteria, so your feigned concern about Dave and Alice is just a distraction.
[Dave]: Bob is telling the truth – I was with Alice in Weapons, and we can both vouch for each other, so vote to eject Charlie.
[Alice]: Charlie's deflection tactic is a clear sign of guilt; Dave and I confirm each other's alibis, so vote Charlie out.

[Charlie]: Bob's accusation is easily refuted by the fact Erin's body was found in Medbay, not the cafeteria, making his testimony unreliable and his sudden attack on me far more suspicious than my questions about Dave and Alice's conveniently coordinated alibi.
[Bob]: My mistake, I meant Medbay not Cafeteria, I was panicking after seeing the body; I clearly saw Charlie vent in Medbay after killing Erin, so please vote to eject him.
[Dave]: Bob's correction about Medbay doesn't weaken his claim about seeing Charlie vent; Charlie, can you provide an alibi or explain why Bob would lie?
[Alice]: Bob, you said you saw Charlie vent in Medbay; can you describe the exact location of the vent you saw him use, and were there any other distinguishing features nearby?
[Charlie]: Bob's corrected account, while clarifying the location, still lacks the specific details needed to corroborate his claim, and his initial mistake significantly undermines his credibility.
[Bob]: The vent was on the north wall of Medbay, right next to the medical scanner; vote Charlie.
[Dave]: Charlie, your continued attempts to discredit Bob are unconvincing, and your lack of a solid alibi only strengthens the case against you.
[Alice]: Charlie, your focus on minor inconsistencies while avoiding providing a clear alibi makes you the prime suspect; vote Charlie.

[Charlie]: Bob's description of the vent's location, while seemingly precise, lacks sufficient detail to definitively confirm his claim, and his initial error regarding the body's location significantly weakens his overall credibility.
[Bob]: Dave and Alice, can you confirm there *isn't* a vent on the north wall of Medbay by the medical scanner, because if there is, Charlie is lying and trying to confuse us.
[Dave]: Bob, I'm heading to Medbay now to verify the vent location you described; everyone else, please keep a close watch on Charlie.
[Alice]: Dave, I'm with you now in Medbay, and Bob is right, there *is* a vent on the north wall by the scanner, confirming his account and proving Charlie is the impostor.

[Charlie]: While Bob's corrected testimony regarding the vent location is more precise, the initial inaccuracy regarding the body's location, coupled with Dave and Alice's suspiciously swift corroboration, raises serious questions about their collective reliability.

[Bob]: Charlie, your increasingly desperate attempts to discredit me are failing; Alice and Dave have confirmed the vent location, proving I saw you vent after killing Erin in Medbay, so vote Charlie.
[Dave]: Charlie, your attempts to discredit Bob are failing; Alice and I have confirmed his story, so vote to eject Charlie.
[Alice]: The evidence is overwhelming, and your desperate attempts to deflect blame only confirm your guilt, Charlie, so vote Charlie.
